This workshop will introduce the use of Large Language Models (LLMs) directly within your R environment. We will explore three packages from the tidyverse/mlverse ecosystem: [`ellmer`](https://ellmer.tidyverse.org/) for direct interaction with LLMs, [`ragnar`](https://ragnar.tidyverse.org) for building Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) workflows, and [`chattr`](https://mlverse.github.io/chattr/) for RStudio context integration. 

**Prerequisites:**

-   Basic knowledge of R and the RStudio IDE.

[![ ](./aiforsci.png)](https://gdg.community.dev/gdg-ai-for-science-australia/)

This workshop is part of the [GDG AI for Science](https://gdg.community.dev/gdg-ai-for-science-australia/) workshop series. Join the community for talks, events, collaborations and more.


## **Installation and Setup**

-   Install the [`ellmer`](https://ellmer.tidyverse.org/),[`ragnar`](https://ragnar.tidyverse.org), and [`chattr`](https://mlverse.github.io/chattr/) package from CRAN as below. *ragnar* may take up to about 1 hour to install. 

-   Set up API keys from https://aistudio.google.com/ or equivalent.
```{r}
#Sys.setenv(GEMINI_API_KEY = "xxxx")
```
-   *Optional* - Setup local LLM with Ollama
    -   Download [Ollama](https://ollama.com/download) and install it
    -   Pull a local model: `ollama pull gemma3:270m-it-qat`
    -   See [Gemma with Ollama](https://ai.google.dev/gemma/docs/integrations/ollama) docs for more info.
